SCENERY.ERROR_NO_SELECTION: Select at least one element type
SCENERY.COPY_RESET_UNSELECTED_HINT: Clear all element types that are not selected, keeping only the copied elements
SCENERY.RESET_SCENE_DATA_CONTENT: Remove all captured scene elements for this variation?
SCENERY.SETTING_DEBUG_LOGGING_HINT: Show debug messages in the browser console (F12).
SCENERY.SETTING_SHOW_HEADER_BUTTON_HINT: Show the Scenery button in the Scene Directory header.
SCENERY.SETTING_SHOW_VARIATIONS_HINT: Show a small label with the count of Scenery variations in the corner of entries in the Scene Directory.
SCENERY.SETTING_GLOBAL_LIGHTS_HINT: Lights stay on the scene when switching variations (not managed by Scenery).
SCENERY.SETTING_GLOBAL_SOUNDS_HINT: Sounds stay on the scene when switching variations (not managed by Scenery).
SCENERY.SETTING_GLOBAL_TILES_HINT: Tiles stay on the scene when switching variations (not managed by Scenery).
SCENERY.SETTING_GLOBAL_WALLS_HINT: Walls stay on the scene when switching variations (not managed by Scenery).
SCENERY.SETTING_GLOBAL_DRAWINGS_HINT: Drawings stay on the scene when switching variations (not managed by Scenery).
SCENERY.SETTING_GLOBAL_TEMPLATES_HINT: Templates stay on the scene when switching variations (not managed by Scenery).
SCENERY.SETTING_GLOBAL_REGIONS_HINT: Regions stay on the scene when switching variations (not managed by Scenery).
SCENERY.SETTING_GLOBAL_NOTES_HINT: Notes stay on the scene when switching variations (not managed by Scenery).
SCENERY.SETTING_GM_MAP_IDENTIFIERS_HINT: Comma-separated tokens that identify GM-specific maps in filenames (e.g. gm, dm). Matched as whole words between separators (- _ . space).
SCENERY.SETTING_PLAYER_MAP_IDENTIFIERS_HINT: Comma-separated tokens that identify Player-specific maps in filenames (e.g. player, pl). Matched as whole words between separators (- _ . space).
SCENERY.SETTING_GLOBAL_RESET_DONE: Global element settings reset to defaults.
